str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
